poem:
"An Ode to Scholarly Shadows"

A library ghost, Roy Bridge by name,
In the nuanced fog of Hapsburg game,
From Sadowa to Sarajevo's din,
He journeyed through thick historical skin.
In Vienna's vaults, he found his fame,
Pen and wisdom, his only claim,
A scholar's echo, veering wide,
In age's curtain, now does hide.
Goodbye my friend, your tale here ends,
Among great powers, you've left your friends.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Roy Bridge obituary My mentor and friend Roy Bridge, who has died aged 85, was the foremost authority on the foreign policy of the late Habsburg empire. He became a leading expert with his first book, From Sadowa to Sarajevo: The Foreign Policy of Austria-Hungary 1866-1914 (1972), later expanded as The Habsburg Monarchy Among the Great Powers, 1815-1918. Grounded in meticulous research in the Vienna archives, those works firmly established the subject of Habsburg diplomacy". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Roy Bridge obituary My mentor and friend Roy Bridge, who has died aged 85, was the foremost authority on the foreign policy of the late Habsburg empire. He became a leading expert with his first book, From Sadowa to Sarajevo: The Foreign Policy of Austria-Hungary 1866-1914 (1972), later expanded as The Habsburg Monarchy Among the Great Powers, 1815-1918. Grounded in meticulous research in the Vienna archives, those works firmly established the subject of Habsburg diplomacy
